title: RT-free Nanopore direct RNA sequencing v1

source.description:
Preparing input RNA:
Record the quality, quantity and size of the input RNA.
Guide criteria:
  • Average fragment size: > 500 bases
  • Mass by Qubit RNA HS assay:
  • Please ensure there are no detergents or surfactants in the buffer
Mass by Qubit RNA HS assay:
    Transfer
    of RNA to a
    PCR tube.
    Adjust the volume to
    with nuclease-free water and proceed by adding buffer as shown in the table in Step 2 (below).

Heat and cool RNA:

1Reagentof [Stock]Addto [Final]
2Poly(A)+ RNAvariable8 µl500 ng or 1.1 pmoles
3TE + NaCl buffer (90 mM TRIS pH 6.5, 9 mM EDTA, 450 mM NaCl)9x1 µl1x
4TOTAL 9.0 µl 
    Place the tube in a thermal cycler with the following program:
    for
    , followed by cooling at
    / second to
    . Approximate time for this step is
    Transfer RNA to a
    DNA LoBind Eppendorf tube and proceed by adding to the tube the additional reagents shown in step 3 (below).

ABCD

2Poly(A)+ RNAvariable8 µl500 ng or 1.1 pmoles
3TE + NaCl buffer (90 mM TRIS pH 6.5, 9 mM EDTA, 450 mM NaCl)9x1 µl1x
4TOTAL 9.0 µl

RT Adapter (RTA) ligation:
ABCD
1Reagentof [Stock]Addto [Final]
2RNA from Step 2 500 ng 9.0 µl 500 ng or 1.1 pmoles
3 RT Adapter (RTA) 1 µl
4RNA Calibration Strand (RCS) (Optional) 50 ng/µl 0.5 µl 25 ng
55x Quick Ligation Reaction Buffer (NEB) 5x 3.0 µl 1x
6T4 DNA Ligase High Concentration (NEB) 2000 U/µl 1.5 µl 200 U/µl
7 TOTAL 15.0 µl
    Incubate the reaction for
    at room temperature.

source.body:
• If not using RCS, substitute with of NSF water.
  • The high concentration T4 DNA ligase (NEB) is essential for the ligation steps to work at optimal efficiency.

source.description: Cleaning up the ligation reaction using Agencourt RNAClean SPRI beads:

Add
(1.8X) of resuspended RNAClean XP beads to the ligation reaction and mix by pipetting.

Incubate on a Hula mixer (rotator mixer) for
at room temperature.

source.body: The tube can be put on a rack at ambient temperature for in the absence of a hula mixer.

source.description: Spin down the sample and pellet on a magnet. Keep the tube on the magnet, and pipette off the supernatant.

Keep the tube on magnet and wash the beads with
of Wash Buffer (WSB) without disturbing the pellet as described below:
  • Keeping the magnetic rack on the benchtop, rotate the bead-containing tube by 180°. Wait for the beads to migrate towards the magnet and form a pellet.
  • Rotate the tube 180° again (back to the starting position), and wait for the beads to pellet.
Remove the WSB using a pipette, and discard.
Spin down and place the tube back on the magnet. Pipette off any residual WSB.

Remove the tube from the magnetic rack and resuspend pellet in
Nuclease-free water.

Incubate for
at room temperature.
Pellet beads on magnet until the eluate is clear and colorless.

Transfer eluate to a clean
DNA LoBind Eppendorf tube and proceed by adding to the tube the additional reagents shown in step 4.

Nanopore sequencing adapter (RMX) ligation:
ABCD
1Reagentof [Stock]Addto [Final]
2RNA from Step 3 20 µl
3 RNA adapter mix (RMX) 6 µl
45x Quick Ligation Reaction Buffer (NEB) 5x 8 µl 1x
5Nuclease-free water 3 µl
6T4 DNA Ligase High Concentration (NEB) 2000 U/µl 3 µl 150 U/µl
7 TOTAL 40 µl
  • Mix by pipetting and spin down.
  • Incubate the reaction for 10 minutes at room temperature.

ABCD
1Reagentof [Stock]Addto [Final]
2RNA from Step 3 20 µl
3 RNA adapter mix (RMX) 6 µl
45x Quick Ligation Reaction Buffer (NEB) 5x 8 µl 1x
5Nuclease-free water 3 µl
6T4 DNA Ligase High Concentration (NEB) 2000 U/µl 3 µl 150 U/µl
7 TOTAL 40 µl

source.body: The high concentration T4 DNA ligase (NEB) is essential for the ligation steps to work at optimal efficiency.

source.description: Cleaning up the ligation reaction using Agencourt RNAClean SPRI beads:

Add
(1X) of resuspended RNAClean XP beads to the ligation reaction and mix by pipetting.

Incubate on a Hula mixer (rotator mixer) for
at room temperature.

source.body: The tube can be put on a rack at ambient temperature for in the absence of a hula mixer.

source.description: Spin down the sample and pellet on a magnet. Keep the tube on the magnet, and pipette off the supernatant.

Add
of the Wash Buffer (WSB) to the beads. Close the tube lid, and resuspend the beads by flicking the tube. Return the tube to the magnetic rack, allow beads to pellet and pipette off the supernatant.
Repeat Step 4.5 a total of 2 washes.

Remove the tube from the magnetic rack and resuspend pellet in
Elution Buffer. Incubate for
at room temperature.
Pellet beads on magnet until the eluate is clear and colorless.

Transfer elutate to a clean
Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube.

Use
of library to quantify using Qubit RNA HS assay.

source.body: This is your final library.

source.description:
Dilute library for loading:
ABCD
1Reagentof [Stock]Addto [Final]
2RNA library from Step 4 20 µl
3Nuclease-free water 80 µl
4RRB 2x 100 µl 1x
5TOTAL 200 µl
Mix the reagents above a clean
Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube and spin down.

source.body: This protocol does not cover flowcell preparation. Please follow the current recommended protocol from Oxford Nanopore Technologies for preparing flowcell (priming and loading) and using software for the sequencing run.

description:
Reverse Transcription-free (RT-free) poly(A) RNA protocol for Nanopore Direct RNA Sequencing
This protocol was developed as a collaboration between NASA Houston, Oxford Nanopore Technologies, and UC Santa Cruz to support direct RNA Nanopore sequencing on the International Space Station (ISS).
Contributors:
  • NASA JSC Houston: Sarah Stahl, Aaron S. Burton, Kristen K. John, Sarah L. Castro-Wallace
  • Oxford Nanopore Technologies: Daniel Jachimowicz, Daniel R. Garalde
  • University of California Santa Cruz: Mark Akeson, Benedict Paten, Miten Jain
  • Oxford Nanopore Technologies: Daniel Jachimowicz, Daniel R. Garalde
  • University of California Santa Cruz: Mark Akeson, Benedict Paten, Miten Jain
